result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Letter filed by the State requesting the victim be allowed to appear by Zoom.
**Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 11/2/2022 - This request is now moot, as the plea hearing referenced has been adjourned.**

Letter from Attorney Simon requesting an adjournment of the plea hearing.
**Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 11/2/2022 - Approved. The plea hearing will be rescheduled to a date in December.**

8:32 AM Defendant Matthew J Galarza in court.  Attorney Thomas C Simon Aty in court for Matthew J Galarza.  Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Victim/Witness and Victim A appear by zoom.
Case called for hearing. 
Court notes Defendant's compliance report from WCS.
Defense requests a plea only hearing. 
Victim may appear by zoom for the plea hearing.
Plea hearing scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Plea hearing on November 8, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
Hearing on September 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

09:30 AM Defendant Matthew J Galarza in court with attorney Thomas C Simon.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Julian Marrufo, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Victim/Witness and Victim A appear by zoom.
Defense has received discovery, but not an offer at this time.
Victim may appear by zoom at the next hearing.

  Hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.

VW Zoom Victim Request

  **Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 08/03/22--approved.**
Hearing on August 5, 2022 at 09:30 am.

CONDITIONS MODIFIED ON 06/27/2022:   If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.

PREVIOUS CONDITIONS:
Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to have no contact with individuals listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key except individuals that are his family.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring and/or drug testing through WCS.  CAM duration and/or drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM and/or drug testing.  Defendant is not to discuss this case with his mother.  Defendant not to leave the State of Wisconsin without prior authorization from the Court.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

08:15 AM Defendant Matthew J Galarza in court with attorney Thomas C Simon.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim A appeared by Zoom with Victim/Witness Specialist Kari Balnkenheim who appeared by Zoom.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Filed by Victim Witness unit, for victim(s) to appear via Zoom. Sent to CC Costello. Court grants request.
